meanings.definition: A person or thing that is old, worn-out, or unreliable.
meanings.sent1: My grandpa's car is a clunkers.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic specializes in fixing clunkers.
meanings.sent3: The clunkers of jokes he tells always make us laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her phone, a clunkers, barely holds a charge anymore.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was full of clunkers furniture and appliances.

meanings.definition: A loud, dull sound made by an object hitting another object.
meanings.sent1: The clunkers of the hammer echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The clunkers of the falling book startled me.
meanings.sent3: The clunkers of the pots and pans clashing woke up the whole house.
meanings.sent4: The clunkers of the heavy door closing signaled the end of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The clunkers of the old typewriter keys were oddly comforting.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, dull sound.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally clunkers the pots while washing dishes.
meanings.sent2: The old engine clunkers loudly when starting up.
meanings.sent3: The kids love to clunkers their toys together to make music.
meanings.sent4: The falling branches clunkers against the roof during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The heavy tools clunkers as they are dropped into the toolbox.
